definition: (usually of sth intangible) to seep into/to permeate
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: Spring coming, the cold melt, the white goes to the deep inside.
sentences.chinese: 春来了，大地暖，冰雪融化沁入深深的枝干。

sentences.english: Very intense aromas of red and black fruit permeate the nose, and follow through to the palate.
sentences.chinese: 非常强烈的成熟水果香气沁入鼻腔，并保留持久。

sentences.english: Simon Edwards stepped forward, swallowing the frog in his throat.
sentences.chinese: 爱德华兹走上前，他强咽下沁入喉中的雾水。

sentences.english: Silk trace moist, deep in quiet heart, with abundance and overflowing joy.
sentences.chinese: 丝丝清润，静静沁入心底，喜悦盈而满溢。

sentences.english: Essential nutrients are infused deep into the skin to help improve the support structure of the epidermis.
sentences.chinese: 精华素的营养元素能深深沁入肌肤以改善表皮组织。

sentences.english: Approaching thin a smell, a surge of Heart and enchanting fragrance Qinru.
sentences.chinese: 走近细细一闻，一股迷人的清香沁入心脾。

sentences.english: Fall has come, cold feeling, Qinru heart.
sentences.chinese: 落下来了，冰凉的感觉，沁入心里。

sentences.english: May sincere feelings of mankind refresh our hearts.
sentences.chinese: 愿，人间的真挚感情沁入你我心脾。

sentences.english: The girl's bashful "Thank you", sounding like that of a silver-bell, seeped into my ears.
sentences.chinese: 一声银铃般的少女羞涩的话音，沁入我的耳畔。
这时候，真相宛如一股抚慰伤口的暖流沁入心间。

definition: to penetrate deeply into the heart (idiom)/to gladden the heart/to refresh the mind
to permeate/to percolate/fig. to saturate (with emotion)
to be contaminated/to be gradually influenced
to dissipate everywhere (of light, sound, gas etc)
